intro: Persoonia tenuifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved geebung, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its slender, often hairy leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in heathlands and woodlands. It is well adapted to dry conditions and can survive in areas with low rainfall. Persoonia tenuifolia is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and hardy nature.
